name: Lucky Eggs
description:
Lucky Eggs is a variant of tic-tac-toe in which you take an opponent's spot by winning a coin flip. The game can be played against the computer or against someone sitting next to you (local multiplayer). The difficulty of the computer opponent can also be adjusted using the dropdown menu below the computer controlled toggle.

Controls
  • Place icons by clicking on the fields
  • Switch icons by clicking the icon next to your score
  • Restart using the button in the bottom left or by pressing R
  • Restarting also changes the colour palette
  • Mute the music by pressing M
Background

In my country tic-tac-toe is called butter, cheese and eggs. The coin flip adds a component of luck. So, the title is a combination of these two aspects. The idea of the game came from someone who remarked that his game was basically tic-tac-toe, but you could take an opponent's spot. This actually seemed pretty interesting to me; resulting in the creation of this game.

The music in the game was made by Marching Dream.

Total development time: 13 hours
